title: Understanding String Functions
text: String functions are used to perform operations on string data types. They can manipulate, format, or extract information from strings.

title: Common String Functions
text: Some common string functions include UPPER(), LOWER(), and TRIM(). These functions are used to change the case of strings or remove whitespace.

title: Non-String Functions
text: Functions like COUNT(), SUM(), and AVG() are not string functions. They are aggregate functions used for numerical data.

title: Identifying Valid String Functions
text: Which of the following are valid string functions?
